amendment.description: Amendment sought to cut $250 million from the Defense Rapid Innovation Program (DRIP), and move the money to alleviate training and readiness shortfalls.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part B of House Report 113-108 to cut $250 million from the Defense Rapid Innovation Program (DRIP), and move the money to alleviate training and readiness shortfalls.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Coffman amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 206 - 220 (Roll no. 224).
